Los Rookies

• Login

  • Parent View

  • Student View 2

  • Student View

  • Teacher View

Inspiration

We were concerned about the disturbingly increased rate that the kids nowadays are dropping out of school.

What it does

It´s a system that alows the parents to have more control over their kids education, allowing them to see if their children are doing well in school, if they are doing their homework, if they are skipping classes, etc. so that they can prevent in time if something bad is about to happen. (everything from drugs to dropping out of school).

How we built it

We used web desingns like HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery, Json, and a lot of UX, IX, IXD to design a user friendly and perfectly understandable interface. In the future we will finish the project with technologies like PHP and MySQL.

Challenges we ran into

We were forced to find a balance between well designed user experience and functionability.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

We believe that this proyect is going to help the future of México by reducing drastically the index of dropouts on middle school and high school students.

What we learned

We learned that the best way to start a proyect of this kind is by finding how we can use it to help others.

What's next for Los Rookies

We are going to continue working on this proyect until we see it fully functioning in every middleschool of the country. Video right here! https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B57dW9-hbQIwcFJiME80V0dhTUU

Plubber

Inspiration

We are software engineering students, and as such, we identified the need to help students from different universities in Ensenada collaborate and help each other out.

What it does

Our app helps this purpose by creating a platform exclusively for this issue. It's a collaborative forum in which students need to sign in and specify their school and major. That way, the information that they provide is going to be more trustworthy than having your questions answered by anyone on the internet.

How we built it

To build our app we used Android Studio for the user interface and MySQL and PHP for the database.

Challenges we ran into

Four of our team members are only in third semester, so their abilities were limited to Java. Only one of us knew how to build a database. The challenge was trying to learn something we had never done and still try to make it work it's best.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

We are all really proud of what we accomplished, taking into account that we had never tried to do anything like this before. Even if we don't win, we are happy, though very tired, of the opportunity that we have had participating in this hackathon.

What we learned

We learned that we are far more capable of developing a project than we thought we were. We have learned to cope through the mistakes and those quiet hours in the early morning when nothing worked out the way it should. We learned that building something is not as hard if you're willing to give it your best.

What's next for Plubber

We plan to keep developing this app and release it in the near future. However, it still has a long way to go.

Bluethalyzer

• Si el usuario falla la prueba, despliega un mensaje que alerta al conductor que no podrá manejar hasta que su grado de alcohol disminuya.

Inspiration

Sentimos que el uso del alcoholímetro no debe estar limitado como una forma de identificar personas alcoholizadas siendo detenidas, sino como una forma de prevenir a la persona alcoholizada de siquiera poder usar el auto, imposibilitándolo de usarlo mientras se encuentre en un grado de alcohol que lo haga legalmente inelegible para conducir. Esto con el fin de prevenir accidentes, pues muchos accidentes vehiculares ocurren debido a personas que han consumido alcohol, y no solo el alcoholizado está peligrando su vida, sino cualquier otra persona que pueda estar en el lugar y momento equivocado. Si podemos aminorar lo más posible muertes causados por el consumo de alcohol con el uso de nuestra creación, estamos logrando una mejor calidad de vida para la sociedad.

What it does

Bluethalyzer es un alcoholímetro instalado en un vehículo que analiza el aliento del conductor y permite o no al usuario conducir su vehículo dependiendo del grado de alcohol de su aliento.

How we built it

Utilizamos tanto software como hardware en la realización de nuestro proyecto. Usamos un sensor de alcohol en conjunto

Challenges we ran into

Tuvimos problemas que nos detuvieron algunas horas, pero logramos arreglar dichos problemas para poder seguir avanzando en nuestro proyecto. Otro desafío fue aplicar ideas en tecnologías que recién aprendimos.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

Logramos hacer un alcoholimetro que detecta niveles de alcohol para entonces desplegar en pantalla los resultados obtenidos del sensor.

What we learned

Algunos de nosotros aprendimos algunas tecnologías y lenguajes para el desarrollo de este proyecto, tales como Apache Cordova, uso de hardware en el manejo de sensores y Javascript.

What's next for Bluethalyzer

Como es un proyecto bastante grande, hicimos una demostración que ejemplifica los puntos más importantes que debe contar nuestro alcoholímetro, ciertamente el siguiente paso será sofisticar nuestro sensor y posiblemente agregarle otros tipos de sensores y/o parametros que hagan de nuestro alcoholimetro más inteligente y dificil de engañar.

What hardware we used

Primero la idea de este proyecto era implementarse con un dispositivo bluetooth pero debido a problemas de hardware y complejidad se cambio a un plan "b", este plan consistió en usa un modulo WiFi (ESP8266) y un sensor que mide el incide de alcohol en el ambiente, este se comunica con una aplicación móvil enviando esta información a un usuario de interés con esta información.

Built With

  • javascript
  • sqlite
  • apache
  • c++

Try it out

  • github.com

Trabajé en la investigación del funcionamiento de alcoholímetros, en el desarrollo de la aplicación donde el alcoholímetro manda los resultados, tanto para Android como iOS con la utilización de Apache Cordova e Intel XDK, y en la documentación del proyecto en general.

Trabajé, en conjunto con el equipo, en el módulo de comunicación UDP del ESP8266  y en la parte de frontend para dar formato en lo que respecta a la aplicación. Por primera vez, trabajé directamente con sensores de éste tipo y sus funcionalidades. Trabajé también con una tecnología de desarrollo totalmente nueva para mí (Cordova Apache), basada en JS/HTML para la creación de aplicaciones móviles.  
Se logró el objetivo de crear un alcoholimetro, que sensa por intervalo de tiempo los grados de alcohol en el ambiente. Con esto, pensamos llevar esto más allá de un solo prototipo, si no de llegar a una aplicación totalmente indispensable en la vida de las personas, ya que con esto, tratamos de prevenir una de las principales causa de muerte en el país, como lo son los accidentes automovilísticos.

Trabaje en la parte del backend del proyecto usando tecnologias como apache cordova, uber api, google services map y sqlite. No es mi fuerte javascript asi que tuve que aprender a adaptarme un poco en la manera que utiliza cordova.

Estuve trabajando con un framework llamado cordova el cual fue nuevo para mí y para la mayoría del equipo por lo que tuvimos algunas dificultades a la hora del desarrollo, pero aprendimos a utilizar apis que nos pueden servir en proyectos mas adelante como la de uber y google
Pues yo trabaje el hardware y firmware y en la conexion entre dispositivos no es mi primera vez que trabajo en proyecto con sistemas embebidos pero fue divertido

AR Remote

Inspiration

Virtual reality and augmented reality have become very important technologies. They have evolved to the point that it is no longer enough to just have a HMD to fully enjoy the immersion experience. We wanted a remote control to play in a virtual environment, but we couldn't afford it.

What it does

AR remote is a low cost remote control for virtual reality that gives the users the expirience of having their hand in the game. It communicates via UDP protocol to any smart phone capable of running virtual reality apps. By using the augmented reality framework Vuforia, we are able to provide the user almost fully postional tracking of the remote in the virtual world.

How we built it

A ESP8266 micro controller, a joystick, some buttons, vuforia and Unity engine to interface it all.

Challenges we ran into

We had problems trying to implement different communication protocolos between the remote and a smart phone, so we decided to use UDP due to its simplicity.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

We mange to work better as a team.

What we learned

How to solder properly, 3D printing, game dev topics, etc.

What's next for AR Remote

We think that this is a good to dive into this new area of development, so we are considering to continue the project in the near future.

Built With

  • unity
  • esp8266
  • c#
  • vuforia
  • google-cardboard
  • vr

Try it out

Happtos

Inspiration

We wanted to create something that would help people achieve their goals and we came across a post in a forum in thalmic labs in which a music teacher asked if anyone could create something like our project, and so we did.

What it does

It provides a way for the director of the music band to communicate via vibrations how fast he is marking the tempo for the blind musicians to play.

How we built it

We used leap motion and its API to map certain gestures and motions to a certain vibration length and amount of vibrations so that the musician and the director can create a custom common language to communicate even if the musician cannot see.

Challenges we ran into

Time, lack of experience in the technologies, we had to adapt the idea to the hardware we had which wasn't ideal. Leap motion isn't ideal in the way it's documented and isn't very precise at reading gestures plus the API didn't give us all we needed in the time we had.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

Building this with a goal in mind even though we knew nothing about the technology used. The team work and the attitudes of the teammates twoards each other.

What we learned

To keep it simple, s... in a hackathon and that cooperative ideas are much more fun.

What's next for Happtos

Developing the ideal hand band for the users and the directors as to improve the amount of combinations possible and the response time. To create an even more general API so that developers can create more solutions for more situations that we haven't tackled.

Cacha Baches

Inspiration

In our city, and other cities in our country, pot-holes are an everyday problem because we always find at least a couple when we drive to work, or any other place. Sometimes so big that on rainy day's car's have dived like sinking ships inside a huge pothole. This raises some questions: ¿How can I find the safest way home that doesn't take forever? ¿Who and how are the road conditions being supervised, prioritized and fixed? This is where Cacha Baches (Pothole Catcher) comes in

What it does

Cacha Baches is a platform that starts with a mobile app that lets users see their gps position in the map and the position of every pothole that has been reported close tho them, it allows users to quickly and easily report the position of new potholes, and it also has the capability to detect bumps in the road and pro-actively ask the user if they just ran into a pothole to help them create a report. The other side is the database that collects the data from all the potholes and records position, aging time, size, and other key data. This enables the placement of potholes on the map in the mobile phone and gives users reporting capabilities to analyze affected areas, monitor the time taken to fix, and other useful information.

How we built it

We built the code for the phone apps in react-native using javascript to have easy compatibility with iOS and Android, the database was built in mySQL and PHP for the API that interfaces the two

Challenges we ran into

mySQL gave us some hard time due to the different version languages and the compatibility issues that this brings, another challenge was that for react-native we had some trouble finding documentation and libraries regarding some advanced gps positioning functionalities that worked in both Android and iOS

Accomplishments that we're proud of

Despite the challenges we found, we are very proud because we completed a working app with the main functionalities that we proposed in the 24 hour hackathon

What we learned

There are so many diferent coding languages and ways to approach a problem with programming, experience and experimentation are key to becoming proficient in finding the best approaches to attack a problem

What's next for Cacha Baches

Continue developing our knowledge so that this and other projects that we thought about while preparing for the hackathon can become real products that make peoples live's better.

Built With

  • javascript
  • react-native
  • mysql
  • php

VideoWatch.Me

Inspiration

Sharing your content is sometime hard, specially if it is large files, like video. Also, if you want to make money by doing entertaining videos, it is limited by the EULAS imposed by the cloud-hosting companies.

Youtube has been criticized by its recent changes to the site rules, so we thought of a decentralized web-sharing platform, where you are the hoster of your files, so you keep full rights and responsibilities on them.

What it does

It shares videos using the WebTorrent protocol, so the videos are available to streaming immediatly, they are not hosted in a centralized server, so they are completely free of third-party licence agreements.

How we built it

Using a node.js server running on Debian GNU/Linux, a SQLite database (only to store usernames, video titles, and magnet link, everything else is decentralized), and a client application made with Electron.

Challenges we ran into

  • WebTorrent is a relatively new protocol, and therefore is lacking some support and key features.
  • CETYS University has all its HTTP ports closed, so it was a little difficult to communicate with our servers.
  • We tried to make a verry ambitious project in too little time, so we had to compromise a little at the end.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

  • The server-client communication works pretty well, although it lacks some GUI polishment and has many security holes.
  • You are able to share your files almost immediatly.
  • We stayed all 24-houres without sleeping.
  • We made a working demo, despite being a big project.

What we learned

  • To use the WebTorrent protocol.
  • To use new features of Node.js and Electron.
  • To better communicate with our team and develop features simultaneously.

What's next for VideoWatch.Me

We are pretty satisfied with our acomplishment. The next steps to accomplish in orther to make VideoWatch.Me an usable service, is to develop a better and more secure server, a cleaner UI, a robust backend, and a less buggy application.

CambioMapa

• LOGO

DesertFox presenta "Cambio Mapa" en Hackathon 2016 Ensenada BC

Descripción del proyecto

Cambio Mapa es una aplacion construida en el moderno framework para desarrollo de apliciones cross platform "IONIC" que en conjunto con el API de Google Maps buscan resolver una necesidad de la comunidad Tijuanense y cualquier otra ciudad fronteriza donde el cambio de divisas sea cosa del día a día.

La situacion económica del país no es la mejor hoy en día y con el reciente aumento en el precio dolar americano y el desplome del peso ante el, los habitantes de estas ciudades se ven severamente afectados por esto ya que gran parte de la población cruza regularmente a los Estados Unidos y esto los obliga a comprar la moneda y ante un sin numero de casas de cambio, valores de compra venta y comisiones, sacar el mayor provecho a nuestro dinero se ha vuelto un proceso un tanto complicado.

He aquí el área de diuturnidad de Cambio Mapa, ya que con la integración de estas tecnologías se busca implementar una aplicaron móvil que mediante el uso de un mapa y GPS nos muestre las casas de cambio a nuestro alrededor, mostrándonos información actualizada y precisa gracias a la colaboración de las casas de cambio y los mismos usuarios que nos rodean facilitando el sacar provecho a nuestro dinero cuando de cambiar divisas se trata.

Monetizar

Mediante publicidad y recomendaciones atractivas se puede generar el patrocinio de establecimientos comerciales, casas de cambio y de mas prestadores de servicios dentro de la aplicación.

Equipo de desarrollo

  • *Camargo Diaz Juan | Desarrollo de Aplicación movil e implementacion con API's *
  • Navarro Mancillas Guillermo | Desarrollo de Aplicaron móvil y UI/UX
  • Valdez Perez Francisco | Diseño Grafico y UI/UX

QuimiKart

Inspiration

nosotros creemos que existe la necesidad de formas alternas para memorizar y entender los compuestos quimicos, que por medio de la repeticion se puede aprender y un videojuego educativo es una forma de lograrlo con una buena aceptacion por el estudiante.

What it does

Ensena la formacion de moleculas quimicas a travez de un divertido juego donde se despierta el interes por el conocimiento con el fin de progresar en el juego y a su vez aprendiendo.

How we built it

Comenzamos desde cero con muchas ideas, cuando decidimos el enfoque del proyecto descargamos los softwares mientras dabamos lectura en guias y tutoriales para conocer este tipo de entornos graficos y con la ayuda de los couch logramos progresar mas rapido y entendiendo lo que debiamos hacer.

Challenges we ran into

No conocer los entornos de trabajo como unity o las librerias que necesitariamos utilizar, teniamos muchas ideas y nos tomo tiempo tomar la decicion final sobre lo que queriamos presentar

Accomplishments that we're proud of

A pesar de que teniamos un margen de tiempo limitado pudimos lograr un resultado decente, nos adaptamos a un tipo de programacion muy diferente y tuvimos una buena experiencia de convivencia con personas de otras partes con los mismos intereses.

What we learned

aprendimos a trabajar en un equipo de personas de diferentes areas de estudios para hacer un proyecto juntos.

What's next for QuimiKart

agregar mas niveles y moleculas, asi como nuevos niveles para hacer que los jovenes encuentren una applicacion divertida.
